title: No-deal tariffs shake-up as ministers prepare for 'do or die' Brexit
text:
Deal or no-deal, ministers are determined to show they are getting on with Brexit as October 31 looms into view.

Hence the Department for International Trade’s publication of a revised list of temporary tariffs applying to UK imports if the UK leaves without an agreement.

Some 88pc of goods will be free from import tariffs for a year, up from 87pc in March, in a move designed to cushion any impact from border disruption if there is a no-deal departure.

Trade minister Conor Burns bullishly insists the UK “will be leaving” - Benn Act or not - and the Government is working to ensure the nation “is ready to trade from day one”.

Observers might be forgiven a sense of deja vu, as the DIT published...
description: Deal or no-deal, ministers are determined to show they are getting on with Brexit as October 31 looms into view.
